mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Sasserno, Victor Adolphus
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Answering letter which Spreafin [?] communicated to him; commercial business with U.S. is of little importance; will be increased by liberty of seat and arrival of foreigners; consul would help them with passports; have consul from every nation except Sweden and Denmark, who will be soon named. [Endorsed by Jefferson.]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1817 August 14, Nice, France to Etienne Cattratan, consul general des Etats Unis d'Amerique, Mar[s]eille, France.
